channel.title: What is your WEI (Windows Experience Index)
channel.description:
Just out of curiosity I wanted to see what others have. Yes, it could be argued that these numbers only hold so much value.
To check you WEI click on start button> right click on computer> Click under rating to get your score.
Please make sure you post your specs ;D
[IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/145ysh.png[/img]
[size=12pt][b]Specs:[/b][/size]
[b]CPU:[/b] Intel Core i7 3770 [b]RAM:[/b] 12gb ddr3 1600 [b]Graphics card[/b]: 7770 Radeon hd 2gb ghz edition [b]Hard drive 1 (boot drive):[/b]120 gb intel Cherryville ssd [b]Hard drive 2 (for everything else):[/b]1Tb seagate 7200 rpm

item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:11, topic:455863”]New build, I win:
ps. no overclocking whatsoever, literally just booted it up an hour ago

[/quote]
I wonder what my desktop would be like under Windows 8.
Too bad I’m too lazy to install that pos called win 8.

item.title: What is your WEI (Windows Experience Index)
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

i’m all for linux, but you’re absolutely disillusioned if you’re gaming on it. ps, there’s a lot more than just the game-devs at ‘fault’ for the lack of games on linux.

Read full topic
item.source: What is your WEI (Windows Experience Index)

item.title: What is your WEI (Windows Experience Index)
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:8, topic:455863”]most games can be converted to play on linux. Heck for that matter I got wow/lotro working on xubuntu…

It isn’t very good yet but there is also a program for linux called “playonlinux” or something like that has several popular games on there.[/quote]
yes, because presenting a phony windows api to the game and most likely not having the best video drivers in the world is the way gaming is meant to be done!

Read full topic
item.source: What is your WEI (Windows Experience Index)

item.title: What is your WEI (Windows Experience Index)

item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

most games can be converted to play on linux. Heck for that matter I got wow/lotro working on xubuntu…

It isn’t very good yet but there is also a program for linux called “playonlinux” or something like that has several popular games on there.

item.title: What is your WEI (Windows Experience Index)
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

the WEI isn’t a particularly good measurement of anything, mine went from 6.9 to 7.1 after a fresh install of windows with no hardware changes, now it’s 5.9, I have an ssd installed along with 3x2tb and a 500gb so transfer speed ain’t a problem when I need it

Read full topic
